whatisens.title: What it is
whatisens.body: The Ethereum Name Service is a distributed, open and extensible naming system based on the Ethereum blockchain. ENS eliminates the need to copy or type long addresses.

howtouse.title: How to use ENS
howtouse.body: The ENS App is a Graphical User Interface for non-technical users. It allows you to search any name, manage their addresses or resources it points to and create subdomains for each name.

renew.title: Names bought in May are expiring soon.
body: You can renew multiple domains in one transaction by going to your
or clicking 'My names' whilst logged in

announcements.migrationOver: ENS Registry Migration Is Over… Now What? A Few Things to Know

permanentRegistrar.title: Learn about the Permanent Registrar and the migration process.

learnmore.title: Learn how to manage your name.

step1.title: 1. Set Resolver
step1.text: The Resolver is a Smart Contract responsible for the process of translating names into addresses. In the Resolver area click ‘Set’. Then click the ‘use public resolver’ link, and ‘save’ to launch the transaction.

step2.title: 2. Set Address
step2.text: Once you have set the Resolver, you can then add records by clicking the ‘+’ in the ‘records’ field. Adding your ethereum address will allow you to point your wallet to your name in the next step.

step3.title: 3. Set Reverse Record
step3.text: Once you set your address, you will see a message saying the reverse pointer is not set. Click the arrow in the field to expand, then click the button ‘save’. This will translate your address into your new name.

namesExpiringSoonBanner.title: Names in May are expiring soon
namesExpiringSoonBanner.text: One of more names are expiring soon, renew them all in one transaction!

address.transactionBanner: You are here because of a transaction we sent you or a referrer from another site. You have names below that need to be renewed soon!

about.elevatorpitch: The Ethereum Name Service is a distributed, open and extensible naming system based on the Ethereum blockchain. ENS eliminates the need to copy or type long addresses.
about.card1: Map simple names like ‘alice.eth’ to Ethereum addresses, content hashes, and metadata.
about.card2: Improve usability of Dapps by returning human readable names instead of long hashes through 'reverse resolution'
about.subdomainText: Like DNS, ENS operates on a system of dot-separated hierarchial names called domains, with the owner of a domain having full control over the allocation of subdomains.

underTheSurface.registrar: The Registrar is the Smart Contract that allows you to buy orregister a domain. Today it uses an auction process, but in the future you will have an instant buy option.
underTheSurface.registry: The Registry is a Smart Contract that contains a list of all domains and subdomains, storing for each two pieces of information: the owner of the name and the Resolver.
underTheSurface.resolver: Resolvers are Smart Contracts responsible for the process of translating names into addresses, or other types of hashes and resources.
underTheSurface.reverse: The Resolver can optionally perform the opposite functionality of 'Reverse Resolving': translating an address into an associated name

search.title: Search for names
search.text: Find domains and subdomains that you can register or learn more about.

favourite.title: Save favourite names
favourite.text: Keep track of domains and subdomains that you own or that you want to follow.

register.title: Register names
register.text: Register .eth names for $5/year. Renew or cancel your name registration at any time.

manage.title: Manage names
manage.text: Point domains to your ethereum addresses, transfer ownership to other people and more.

nofavouritesDomains.title: No names have been saved.
nofavouritesDomains.text: To add names to favourites, click the heart icon next to any desired name.

nofavouritesSubdomains.title: No Subdomains have been saved.
nofavouritesSubdomains.text: To add names to favourites, click the heart icon next to any desired name.
